oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Soldiers preparing for patrol near Vung Chua Mountain

oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Two soldiers carrying M-60 machine guns and ammunition belts. A small Vietnamese woman in profile stands between the two soldiers. She is dressed in pale blue and wears earrings, bracelets, and sandals.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Firearms; Military uniforms; Rifles; Military personnel; Soldiers; Men; Women
Ammons, Christopher D., 1948- ; Vietnam War, 1961-1975; United States. Army. Military Police Company, 194th; United States -- Armed Forces -- Ordnance and ordnance stores; Weapons
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Ammons, Christopher D., 1948-
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Christopher Ammons was born in Norfolk, Virginia, on April 18, 1948. He enlisted in the Army on June 1, 1967, and served with the 1st Infantry Division and later with the 194th Military Police Company. He served two tours in Vietnam, 1967-1968 and 1969-1970. His photographs show details of the daily life of soldiers in Vietnam.
